private_information: I can drive between places; driving increases fuel-cost by 10 per move
I can carry crates subject to capacity constraints
truck0.goal: Assist in moving crates to satisfy the global crate placement goals while respecting capacity and minimizing fuel-cost.

private_information: I can drive between places; driving increases fuel-cost by 10 per move
I can carry crates subject to capacity constraints
truck1.goal: Assist in moving crates to satisfy the global crate placement goals while respecting capacity and minimizing fuel-cost.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist0.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist1.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist2.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist3.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist4.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I can lift/place crates at my location; lifting or operating increases fuel-cost by 1
I can hold at most one crate at a time
hoist5.goal: Use lifting/putting actions at my location to enable crate rearrangements required by the global goals.

private_information: I coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the environment goal
I must respect all private constraints of trucks and hoists and the public environment state
I generate a PDDL domain and problem encoding the integrated multi-agent planning model and objective to minimize fuel-cost
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem that model trucks, hoists, crates, pallets, places, numeric loads and fuel-cost, such that a planner can find plans minimizing fuel-cost to achieve the environment goals.

init.adjacencies: All places are reachable by trucks (complete connectivity) with driving cost reflected by fuel-cost increment of 10 per drive

public_information: There are 3 depots: depot0, depot1, depot2
There are 3 distributors: distributor0, distributor1, distributor2
Hoists: hoist0, hoist1, hoist2, hoist3, hoist4, hoist5
Fuel-cost starts at 0 and increases by 10 for truck drives and by 1 for each hoist lift/operate
Trucks have numeric current_load and load_limit; crates have numeric weight

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The truck0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
The truck1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
The hoist0's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
The hoist1's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
The hoist2's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
The hoist3's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}.
The hoist4's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}.
The hoist5's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. The model must include: places, trucks, hoists, pallets, crates, relations at/on/in, clear/available/lifting resource predicates, numeric fluents for truck current_load, crate weights, load limits, and a global numeric fuel-cost that is incremented correctly by drive and hoist operations. Encode capacity constraints for loading into trucks as numeric preconditions. Include actions: drive(truck, from, to), hoist-lift(hoist, crate, surface, place), hoist-put-down(hoist, crate, surface, place), hoist-put-in-truck(hoist, crate, truck, place), hoist-take-out-truck(hoist, crate, truck, place). Use distinct agent action names or type annotations so agent responsibilities are clear. The objective should minimize fuel-cost. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
